_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Python Chatbot
author: loki@crazycoder.dev
startup: if [[ ! -z "{{PY_PACKAGES}}" ]]; then pip install -U --prefix .local {{PY_PACKAGES}}; fi; if [[ -f /home/container/${REQUIREMENTS_FILE} ]]; then pip install -U --prefix .local -r ${REQUIREMENTS_FILE}; fi; /usr/local/bin/python /home/container/{{PY_FILE}}

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Python App Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
apt update
apt install -y git curl jq file unzip make gcc g++ python python-dev libtool

mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

if [ "${USER_UPLOAD}" == "true" ] || [ "${USER_UPLOAD}" == "1" ]; then
    echo -e "assuming user knows what they are doing have a good day."
    exit 0
fi

## add git ending if it's not on the address
if [[ ${GIT_ADDRESS} != *.git ]]; then
    GIT_ADDRESS=${GIT_ADDRESS}.git
fi

if [ -z "${USERNAME}" ] && [ -z "${ACCESS_TOKEN}" ]; then
    echo -e "using anon api call"
else
    GIT_ADDRESS="https://${USERNAME}:${ACCESS_TOKEN}@$(echo -e ${GIT_ADDRESS} | cut -d/ -f3-)"
fi

## pull git python repo
if [ "$(ls -A /mnt/server)" ]; then
    echo -e "/mnt/server directory is not empty."
    if [ -d .git ]; then
        echo -e ".git directory exists"
        if [ -f .git/config ]; then
            echo -e "loading info from git config"
            ORIGIN=$(git config --get remote.origin.url)
        else
            echo -e "files found with no git config"
            echo -e "closing out without touching things to not break anything"
            exit 10
        fi
    fi

    if [ "${ORIGIN}" == "${GIT_ADDRESS}" ]; then
        echo "pulling latest from github"
        git pull
    fi
else
    echo -e "/mnt/server is empty.\ncloning files into repo"
    if [ -z ${BRANCH} ]; then
        echo -e "cloning default branch"
        git clone ${GIT_ADDRESS} .
    else
        echo -e "cloning ${BRANCH}'"
        git clone --single-branch --branch ${BRANCH} ${GIT_ADDRESS} .
    fi

fi

export HOME=/mnt/server

echo "Installing python requirements into folder"
if [[ ! -z ${PY_PACKAGES} ]]; then
    pip install -U --prefix .local ${PY_PACKAGES}
fi

if [ -f /mnt/server/requirements.txt ]; then
    pip install -U --prefix .local -r ${REQUIREMENTS_FILE}
fi

echo -e "install complete"
exit 0

variables.name: App py file
variables.description: The file that starts the App.

variables.name: Additional Python packages
variables.description:
Install additional python packages.

Use spaces to separate

variables.name: Requirements file
variables.description: if there are other requirements files to choose from.

variables.name: Channel ID
variables.description: The channel you want the chatbot to respond to messages in

variables.name: Bot Name
variables.description: What name you want to call your bot with; you'll send the bot a message that you want it to respond to with "Hey " and the name of the bot.

variables.name: Debug
variables.description: Whether the program should be in debug mode or not, giving more output.
